intro: Peucedanum donnellii, commonly known as the Chinese cow parsley, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Its seeds are often used in traditional Chinese medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant's aromatic foliage and floral structure make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
